com.here.android.mpa.mapping

Class MapMarker

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.here.android.mpa.common.ViewObject
      • com.here.android.mpa.mapping.MapObject
        • com.here.android.mpa.mapping.MapMarker
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MapLabeledMarker

    public class MapMarker
extends MapObject
    Represents a marker used to display an icon at a geographical position on a map. The map handles proper placement of icons on the screen as well as panning and rotation.

    MapMarker objects can be selected by application users.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MapMarker

        public MapMarker()
        Creates a default MapMarker. The marker will contain the default marker image.
        See Also:
        MapMarker.MapMarker(float), MapMarker.MapMarker(GeoCoordinate), MapMarker.MapMarker(GeoCoordinate, Image)

      • MapMarker

        public MapMarker(float hue)
        Creates a default MapMarker. The marker will contain a colorization of the default marker image.
        Parameters:
        hue - The hue of the marker. Value must be greater or equal to 0 and less than 360.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - For hue values outside the acceptable range.
        See Also:
        MapMarker.MapMarker(), MapMarker.MapMarker(GeoCoordinate), MapMarker.MapMarker(GeoCoordinate, Image)

      • MapMarker

        public MapMarker(GeoCoordinate coordinate)
        Creates a MapMarker with a specified GeoCoordinate.
        Parameters:
        coordinate - A GeoCoordinate representing the map coordinates of the marker.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the provided coordinate is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the provided coordinate is invalid.
        See Also:
        MapMarker.MapMarker(), MapMarker.MapMarker(float), MapMarker.MapMarker(GeoCoordinate, Image)

      • MapMarker

        public MapMarker(GeoCoordinate coordinate,
                 Image image)
        Creates a MapMarker with a specified GeoCoordinate and Image.
        Parameters:
        coordinate - A GeoCoordinate representing the map coordinates of the marker
        image - An Image used to display the marker
        See Also:
        MapMarker.MapMarker(), MapMarker.MapMarker(float), MapMarker.MapMarker(GeoCoordinate)

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getCoordinate

        Returns the current map GeoCoordinate for this MapMarker.
        Returns:
        The current GeoCoordinate location

      • setAnchorPoint

        public MapMarker setAnchorPoint(android.graphics.PointF anchor)
        Sets an anchor point for this MapMarker.

        The marker is drawn with the specified pixel offset from its MapMarker.getCoordinate() position. To clear an anchor set previously, pass a PointF to this method with an X-coordinate equal to half the width of the marker and a Y-coordinate equal to half the height of the marker.

        By default, there is no offset and the MapMarker is centered in the center of the icon image.

        Parameters:
        anchor - A PointF relative to the top-left corner of the MapMarker.
        Returns:
        The updated MapMarker itself.

      • getAnchorPoint

        public android.graphics.PointF getAnchorPoint()
        Returns the anchor point for this MapMarker.

        The marker is drawn with the specified pixel offset from its MapMarker.getCoordinate() position. To clear an anchor set previously, pass a PointF to this method with an X-coordinate equal to half the width of the marker and a Y-coordinate equal to half the height of the marker.

        By default, there is no offset and the MapMarker is centered in the center of the icon image.

        Returns:
        The anchor point for this MapMarker.

      • setDraggable

        public MapMarker setDraggable(boolean isDraggable)
        Sets whether this marker is draggable or not. By default, the marker is not draggable.

        If any user overridden methods of MapGesture.OnGestureListener.onLongPressEvent(PointF) or MapGesture.OnGestureListener.OnGestureListenerAdapter.onDoubleTapEvent(PointF) that is registered with MapGesture returns true, the MapMarker will ignore any drag events even if the marker is set to enable dragging.

        Parameters:
        isDraggable - true if the marker is draggable, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        The updated MapMarker itself.
        See Also:
        MapGesture

      • isDraggable

        public boolean isDraggable()
        Returns a boolean indicating whether the marker is draggable.
        Returns:
        True if the marker is draggable, false otherwise.

      • setDraggingOffsetEnabled

        public MapMarker setDraggingOffsetEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Sets whether this marker has offset from the tap coordinate during dragging to avoid overlapping marker image by user's finger. By default, dragging offset is enabled.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true if the marker has offset, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        The updated MapMarker itself.

      • isDraggingOffsetEnabled

        public boolean isDraggingOffsetEnabled()
        Returns a boolean indicating whether the marker applies the dragging offset.
        Returns:
        True if the marker applies dragging offset, false otherwise.

      • setTransparency

        public boolean setTransparency(float alpha)
        Sets a transparency level, within the range of [0..1], for the icon.
        Parameters:
        alpha - Desired alpha value for the icon, 0 for fully transparent, 1 for fully opaque (the default value is 1)
        Returns:
        True if successful, false otherwise.

      • getTransparency

        public float getTransparency()
        Gets the current transparency for the icon

        The transparency level is only precise to two decimal places due to numerical operations performed internally when rendering the map.

        Returns:
        The current transparency of the icon

      • setDeclutteringEnabled

        public MapMarker setDeclutteringEnabled(boolean enabled)
        This method enables or disables decluttering in tilted view. By enabling this, icons will not be shown when they are faraway in tilted view. By default, decluttering is disabled.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true means enabling icon decluttering.
        Returns:
        The updated MapMarker itself.

      • isDeclutteringEnabled

        public boolean isDeclutteringEnabled()
        This method queries if the icon decluttering is enabled.
        Returns:
        True if the decluttering is enabled. Otherwise return false.

      • setSvgIconScaling

        public boolean setSvgIconScaling(float scale)
        Set a scaling factor for markers using SVG Image. Only works with scales from 1.0 to 2.0 inclusive.
        Parameters:
        scale - Scaling factor.
        Returns:
        true if the scaling factor has been applied (number from 1.0 to 2.0), false otherwise.

      • getSvgIconScaling

        public float getSvgIconScaling()
        Get the scaling factor for markers using SVG Image.
        Returns:
        scale

      • setTitle

        public MapMarker setTitle(java.lang.String title)
        Sets a title to be used by the default info bubble.
        Parameters:
        title - The title to set.
        Returns:
        The updated MapMarker itself.

      • getTitle

        public java.lang.String getTitle()
        Gets the current title to be used by the default info bubble.
        Returns:
        The current title. Can be null if it has not been set.

      • setDescription

        public MapMarker setDescription(java.lang.String description)
        Sets the description text. This will be shown below the title in normal typeface.
        Parameters:
        description - The description to be set.
        Returns:
        The updated MapMarker itself.

      • getDescription

        public java.lang.String getDescription()
        Gets the current description text.
        Returns:
        The current description. Can be null if it has not been set.
